content: I looked through all the Zulip topics for anything that seemed relevant to the outreach meetings or marketing, but I didn't see anything. So I'm creating a new channel, "Marketing Backdrop". Let's see how this goes :)

Anyway, I just wanted to find a place to post this, since it seems relevant:

https://www.mydropwizard.com/blog/drupal-8-has-left-small-non-profits-behind-how-can-we-fix

There's also this. (I'm not agreeing with the sentiment of the headline, just interested in the issues that it brings up)

https://www.mydropwizard.com/blog/drupal-sucks-non-profits

Drupal Sucks at Non-Profits
If you're a non-profit volunteer, board member, director, or staff, should you be afraid of using Drupal for your website needs?There's been a lot of doom and gloom in the Drupal Community with Drupal 8 being more complex than ever! Other "content management systems" (a.k.a. CMS's) have long claimed that "Drupal is hard", "Drupal is expensive".Is Drupal hard? Is Drupal 8 even "harder"? Is it "too expensive" for your non-profit?Does Drupal suck at non-profits?In this article, I take a deep dive, looking at what non-profits need from a website and how well Drupal can provide for those needs.Read on to see what I think, and PLEASE, share your thoughts in the comments below!Note: we posted a follow-up with an idea for a solution to this problem at Drupal 8 has left small non-profits behind... How can we fix that?

I've read both of these articles back in 2017 @Luke McCormick ...and there were quite a few comments mentioning Backdrop. We seem to not have included these articles in our https://backdropcms.org/news/mentions page (because Backdrop is only mentioned in the comments I guess - not in the main article) ...but should we?
@StPaulTim @jenlampton what do you guys think?
If it's just mentioned in the comments I don't think we should include it
